events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred at the intersection on May 9th, requesting to file a claim for damages.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident following the initial report of the vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case promptly and ensure timely communication with the customer.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and providing details on the next steps.
The agent requested a copy of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a repair estimate from the customer.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and vehicle repair quotes within the specified timeframe.
The insurance company began investigating the claim to verify the details of the accident and assess liability and damages.
Investigation findings were completed, confirming the collision circumstances and validating the submitted repair estimates.
A settlement offer was proposed to the policyholder covering the repair costs minus the deductible as per the policy terms.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement offer and prompt handling of the claim.
The claim approval was finalized, confirming authorization to proceed with payment for the vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued directly to the repair shop as agreed upon, facilitating timely vehicle restoration for the customer.
The claim case was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and no further issues were reported.
All documents and communications related to the auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference and compliance.
